CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ruth Moss, housewife, 1078 Rivermont Drive, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "No, I don't. For one thing it is not good for their health and they have plenty of time to begin smoking.  The 25 or 26 cents which the children would use for buying a pack of cigarettes could well be used to buy something more ...
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruth Moss wearing eyeglasses and tweed coat, standing in front of shoe store
